title: Exploring NEON Water Quality
text: vignette explores neon_water_quality dataset included neonWaterQuality package. dataset contains high-frequency (15-minute intervals) water quality measurements three US sites (Arikaree River, Caribou Creek, Lewis Run) managed National Ecological Observatory Network (NEON) years 2018-2019. data processing follows methodology described paper: Kermorvant C, Liquet B, Litt G, Mengersen K, Peterson EE, Hyndman RJ, et al. (2023) Understanding links water-quality variables nitrate concentration freshwater streams using high frequency sensor data. PLoS ONE 18(6): e0287640. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0287640 demonstrate load data perform basic exploratory analysis.

title: Exploring NEON Water Quality
code: # Load the specific dataset data("neon_water_quality")  # Display the first few rows head(neon_water_quality) #>   siteID       siteName            datetime nitrate temperature #> 1   ARIK Arikaree River 2018-11-16 18:15:00     1.5    5.762667 #> 2   ARIK Arikaree River 2018-11-16 18:30:00     1.5    5.955667 #> 3   ARIK Arikaree River 2018-11-16 18:45:00     1.5    6.173333 #> 4   ARIK Arikaree River 2018-11-16 19:00:00     1.5    6.438333 #> 5   ARIK Arikaree River 2018-11-16 19:15:00     1.5    6.659333 #> 6   ARIK Arikaree River 2018-11-16 19:30:00     1.5    6.860333 #>   dissolved_oxygen specific_conductance turbidity log_turbidity elevation #> 1         9.030000             600.1675 0.5162500     0.4162402   1179.47 #> 2         9.019333             600.0707 0.5200000     0.4187103   1179.47 #> 3         9.004000             599.5880 0.5166667     0.4165149   1179.47 #> 4         8.984000             599.1787 0.4960000     0.4027949   1179.47 #> 5         8.966000             598.8213 0.4920000     0.4001175   1179.47 #> 6         8.941333             598.4727 0.4893333     0.3983286   1179.47  # Show the structure str(neon_water_quality) #> Classes 'data.table' and 'data.frame':   43215 obs. of  10 variables: #>  $ siteID              : chr  "ARIK" "ARIK" "ARIK" "ARIK" ... #>  $ siteName            : chr  "Arikaree River" "Arikaree River" "Arikaree River" "Arikaree River" ... #>  $ datetime            : POSIXct, format: "2018-11-16 18:15:00" "2018-11-16 18:30:00" ... #>  $ nitrate             : num  1.5 1.5 1.5 1.5 1.5 1.5 1.6 1.6 1.6 1.6 ... #>  $ temperature         : num  5.76 5.96 6.17 6.44 6.66 ... #>  $ dissolved_oxygen    : num  9.03 9.02 9 8.98 8.97 ... #>  $ specific_conductance: num  600 600 600 599 599 ... #>  $ turbidity           : num  0.516 0.52 0.517 0.496 0.492 ... #>  $ log_turbidity       : num  0.416 0.419 0.417 0.403 0.4 ... #>  $ elevation           : num  1179 1179 1179 1179 1179 ... #>  - attr(*, ".internal.selfref")=<externalptr>

title: Exploring NEON Water Quality
text: chunk uses dplyr calculate summary statistics key variables, grouped site. Summary statistics key water quality variables site. table shows minimum, median, mean, maximum values main water quality variables three NEON sites. Notice typical ranges different. example, Lewis Run much higher median nitrate concentration Arikaree River Caribou Creek, Caribou Creek much lower specific conductance. differences show different weather environment site.
code: # Calculate summary statistics for key variables by site summary_stats <- neon_water_quality %>%   group_by(siteName) %>%   summarise(     across(c(nitrate, temperature, dissolved_oxygen, specific_conductance, turbidity, elevation),             list(              min = ~min(.x, na.rm = TRUE),              median = ~median(.x, na.rm = TRUE),              mean = ~mean(.x, na.rm = TRUE),              max = ~max(.x, na.rm = TRUE)            ),            .names = "{.col}_{.fn}")   ) %>%   ungroup()  # Print the summary table nicely knitr::kable(summary_stats, caption = "Summary statistics for key water quality variables by site.")

title: Exploring NEON Water Quality
text: chunk creates histograms show distribution nitrate concentrations site, faceted easy comparison. Distribution nitrate concentrations site. histograms show nitrate levels spread site. distributions different. Lewis Run distribution centred around much higher concentrations, Arikaree Caribou Creek distributions skewed towards lower values. scales = “free” argument used ranges different.
code: ggplot(neon_water_quality, aes(x = nitrate)) +   geom_histogram(bins = 30, fill = "skyblue", color = "black", alpha = 0.7) +   facet_wrap(~siteName, scales = "free") + # free scales for better visibility   labs(     title = "Distribution of Nitrate Concentrations",     x = "Nitrate (µmol/L)",     y = "Frequency (Count of 15-min intervals)"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: Exploring NEON Water Quality
text: chunk plots nitrate concentration time three sites. Nitrate concentration study period (2018-2019). graph shows nitrate levels changed time site. can see different patterns changes. Lewis Run higher overall nitrate levels may noticeable seasonal changes patterns Caribou Creek, relatively stable noisy, patterns Arikaree River, sometimes irregular.
code: ggplot(neon_water_quality, aes(x = datetime, y = nitrate, color = siteName)) +   geom_line(alpha = 0.8) +   facet_wrap(~siteName, ncol = 1, scales = "free_y") + # Stacked vertically, free y-axis   labs(     title = "Nitrate Concentration Over Time",     x = "Date",     y = "Nitrate (µmol/L)"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Exploring NEON Water Quality
text: chunks recreate scatter plots similar implicitly discussed paper building GAM models. Relationship nitrate specific conductance. Nitrate vs. Specific Conductance scatter plot explores relationship nitrate specific conductance. paper says relationship different different sites. seems complicated, non-linear relationship Caribou Creek, patterns Arikaree River Lewis Run different, especially lower conductance values. Relationship nitrate log-transformed turbidity. Nitrate vs. Log-Turbidity look relationship nitrate concentration turbidity changed logs. relationship seems weak changes site site. negative Caribou Arikaree, complicated Lewis Run. line paper’s GAM analysis, found wide confidence intervals.
code: ggplot(neon_water_quality, aes(x = specific_conductance, y = nitrate)) +   geom_point(aes(color = siteName), alpha = 0.3, size = 0.5) + # Add color, reduce alpha/size   facet_wrap(~siteName, scales = "free") + # Free scales are essential   labs(     title = "Nitrate vs. Specific Conductance",     x = "Specific Conductance (µS/cm)",     y = "Nitrate (µmol/L)"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(legend.position = "none") ggplot(neon_water_quality, aes(x = log_turbidity, y = nitrate)) +   geom_point(aes(color = siteName), alpha = 0.3, size = 0.5) +   facet_wrap(~siteName, scales = "free") +   labs(     title = "Nitrate vs. Log-Turbidity",     x = "Log(Turbidity + 1)",     y = "Nitrate (µmol/L)"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Exploring NEON Water Quality
text: “neon_water_quality” dataset great way learn water quality changes different environments. Nitrate levels relate factors, temperature specific conductance, differ lot one site next. explore interactively, run launch_app() open Shiny app comes package.

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Welcome neonWaterQuality R package, package provides high-frequency water quality data three NEON sites (ARIK (Arikaree River), CARI (Caribou Creek), LEWI(Lewis Run)) 2018-2019, analyzed Kermorvant et al. (2023). also includes Shiny application explore data interactively. package created Assessment 4 ETC5523 (Communicating Data).

what: High-Frequency Water Quality Data from NEON — neon_water_quality
title: High-Frequency Water Quality Data from NEON — neon_water_quality
text: dataset containing 15-minute aggregated water quality measurements three NEON sites: Arikaree River, Caribou Creek, Lewis Run, spanning 2018-2019. data processed raw data provided NEON, following methods Kermorvant et al. (2023).

title: High-Frequency Water Quality Data from NEON — neon_water_quality
High-Frequency Water Quality Data from NEON — neon_water_quality
text: data frame 42315 rows 10 variables: siteID NEON site code (ARIK, CARI, LEWI) siteName Full name NEON site datetime Timestamp 15-minute interval (POSIXct) nitrate Nitrate concentration (µmol/L) temperature Water temperature (°C) dissolved_oxygen Dissolved oxygen (mg/L) specific_conductance Specific conductance (µS/cm) turbidity Turbidity (FNU) log_turbidity Log-transformed turbidity (log(turbidity + 1)) elevation Surface water elevation (meters)

title: High-Frequency Water Quality Data from NEON — neon_water_quality
